Our lives have become very busy over time. Often, it takes time to manage or
remember multiple things at once. Add the constant on-the-go lifestyle, and
things get even more complicated. For example, having paper-based journals or
planners is almost impossible. However, an intelligent goal-setting app on our
smartphones is the solution.

Mobile phones and tablets have built-in planner apps that let users set their
reminders and tasks. However, they have limited features which do not work
well for people who want efficient goal-setting solutions. To solve their
problem, we present a list of the top goal-setting apps you can use to set,
track, and fulfill your goals.

## 1\. Week Plan

Week Plan is one of the best goal-setting apps around. Week Plan stands out
because it offers tailored planners for various purposes. Each of these
planners focuses on exclusive needs and promises to deliver desired results.

The goal-setting app by Week Plan has gained popularity in a short time
because of its valuable features and ease of use. Week Plan’s application is
based on objective key results and SMART goals, making it highly efficient.
This application is equally helpful for entrepreneurs, businesses, and
individuals.

### Features

  * Objective Key Results
  * SMART goals
  * Subtasks and milestones
  * High-impact tasks
  * Journaling
  * Calendar view
  * Weekly activity review
  * Daily summary
  * Track progress
  * Add teams

### Top 3 Features

#### 1 . Setting SMART Goals

We are all aware of the significance of SMART goals in setting and achieving
our plans. SMART is the acronym for specific, measurable, achievable,
relevant, and time-bound. A goal will be fulfilled when it is set by keeping
these aspects in mind. Whether they are business goals or personal ones, being
SMART is the key to success.

Week Plan is a unique goal-setting application that facilitates users in
setting goals they can achieve. It incorporates the SMART framework in its
application. This means users are default setting their goals by the most
efficient model.

Not only this, Week Plan lets users break their goals into smaller milestones.
Some countless articles and blogs highlight the importance and benefits of
dividing goals into smaller ones. Week Plan implements these benefits into
action without compromising on the SMART goals.

#### 2\. Journaling

Making journal entries and jotting down notes with tasks or reminders is a
significant aspect of setting goals. Writing notes help us add minute details
to our goals, how we wish to achieve them, and other details. Especially those
who understand the therapeutic benefits of journaling can understand the
immense help journaling brings in accomplishing our objectives.

The goal tracker app by Week Plan has done us all a great favor by adding the
journaling feature to its mobile app. It lets users set goals, stay connected
to their progress, and even express their feelings through journal entries.
The goal journal is easy to use and can be accessed anytime. It connects to
the goals so users can review their entries associated with a particular task.

Researchers deduce a direct link between journaling and goal achievement.
Scientific studies have found that writing about business or personal goals
provides a perspective and helps complete set targets. Week Plan puts these
studies into practice and does immense favor to all users.

#### 3\. High-Impact Tasks

Our goals and objectives are comprised of several actions. Each action brings
us a step closer to our target. However, some actions hold more value than
others. Additionally, some tasks are more important than others, and
completing them has a greater impact on our overall achievement score.

Week Plan is a great goal-setting application designed with a keen observation
of human behaviors and a special focus on ways of enhancing efficiency. It
allows users to add high-impact tasks and complete them before the rest. By
prioritizing these tasks, users experience relief from getting closer to
completing their goals.

### Pros

  * Users can set quarterly goals
  * Focus on high-impact tasks
  * Very easy to use
  * Simple layout
  * Allows users to take notes or make entries on goals and tasks

### Cons

  * Too simple
  * Some users find the layout too plain

### Conclusion

Week Plan is the most advantageous goal-setting app around. It checks all
boxes of technology and utility tool designed with special consideration for
human behaviors and thinking patterns. One might just think productivity
psychologists have developed it.

Week Plan’s goal-setting app is packed with useful features such as SMART
goal-setting and task prioritization, which works perfectly for individuals
and business goals. It is available on all devices, giving users instant
access to their goals and tasks wherever they are.

Week Plan’s mobile app is simple and easy to use. Its to-the-point layout
focuses on your goals, not unnecessary bells and whistles.

## 2\. ClickUp

ClickUp is one of the most famous and frequently used goal-setting apps. This
goal-tracking app lets users focus on their daily goals, and lets teams stay
in sync with their targets and tasks.

What makes ClickUp a preference is its interactive features and multiple
options for setting goals and determining goal types. Its free version is also
a significant attraction for single users. Users can take benefit of its
features without paying any monthly subscription or annual fee. However,
depending on their size, it offers paid plans for teams and businesses.

### Features

  * Goal timelines
  * Progress tracking
  * Multiple target types
  * Objective key results (OKR)
  * Goal folders
  * Shareable goals
  * Add teams

### Top 3 Features

  1. Objective Key Results

Objective Key Results, or OKRs, are an effective way to set and complete
goals. The OKR framework focuses on having objectives and measuring their
results using key metrics or KPIs. This method especially benefits large
organizations with business goals based on numbers or other performance
metrics.

ClickUp includes the OKR framework for setting goals in its goal tracker app.
This lets teams and businesses get goals with key performance indicators to
analyze progress in the right direction.

2\. Multiple Target Types

Different types of goals have different criteria to measure their progress or
completeness. Some tasks involve sub-tasks, while others require entering
start and end numbers to determine progress. Others involve simply marking
work as done or not done. However, most goal-setting applications lack the
diversity to cater to varying goal types.

ClickUp caters to this concerns and includes helpful task target parameters
which users can use to mark their work as done. These trackers include tasks
and subtasks, numbers, money targets, and true or false trackers.

With different ways of marking goals as complete, users get more freedom to
set different goals and effectively measure their progress in a number of
ways.

3\. Shareable Goals

This feature is particularly helpful for teams working in a remote setup. All
team members must stay updated with company goals and tasks that lead to it.
Each member is delegated some tasks or responsibilities and all other members
of the team must be updated on progress.

The best way to ensure seamless workflow is by creating shareable goals which
every member can view, comment, and update on. ClickUp introduces the
shareable goals feature to ensure smooth work operations across all
departments and provide maximum team participation.

ClickUp users can get goals and authorize multiple users to access them.
Additionally, it allows creating multiple leaders who can acces and modify the
goals and their associated tasks. Other team members can update their progress
and view goals.

This system defines a hierarchy in work and related decisions which ensure
efficient work completion. By defining team leaders and members, workplaces
can enhance their productivity and create organized workflow.

### Pros

  * Different targets according to goals
  * View and access for team members
  * Progress tracking
  * Intuitive interface
  * Easy migration from other apps

### Cons

  * Unnecessary reminders
  * Problems in android app
  * Confusing features and layout
  * Multiple features sometimes become too complicated for users
  * Issues in app loading during simultaneous work

### Supported Platforms

  * Windows
  * macOS
  * Android
  * iOS

  * Business, for mid-sized teams, at $19 per member

    * Unlimited, for small teams, at $5 per member per month

### Conclusion

ClickUp has gained a handsome reputation among users as a handy goal-setting
app. It offers maximum functionality to facilitate the creation of manageable
tasks and set different ways of measuring progress over time.

However, users complain about its complex layout and issues with app loading,
which is attributed to all the extra features added to the mobile app.
Although they have their utility, too many features make the application
challenging and confusing to grasp.

## 3\. Strides

Among the list of top goal-setting and habit-tracking apps is Strides, and for
a good reason. This simple yet efficient habit tracker lets users create and
achieve personal goals in no time.

Strides makes use of the SMART framework to set goals. It also enables users
to eliminate bad habits and adopt good ones for a better lifestyle. It is
available on Apple devices, including the Apple Watch, so users are connected
with their goals anywhere and anytime.

### Features

  * Goals tracking
  * Habits tracker
  * Multiple tracker types
  * Habit reports
  * SMART goals
  * Daily goals
  * Habit streaks

### Top 3 Features

  1. Different Tracker Types

Strides offers multiple ways of tracking progress. It has the option of
swiping for yes or no, which is best for tracking habits. Selecting a yes or
no option is suitable for adopting or eliminating certain habits. The flexible
reminders ensure constant checks, and follow-ups do not get on your nerves.

For example, users can swipe for “yes” if they have exercised that day.
Similarly, they can select “no” for not smoking on a particular day. Thus,
they can stay updated with their good or bad habits by adopting simple
tracking methods.

The target-based method works for exponential progress-based tasks. Users can
enter their start and end progress and use numerical values to measure
progress. This method best suits entrepreneurs and business owners wishing to
track their monetary progress and analyze business growth.

The other two methods of tracking progress are average-based and project-
based. Both are helpful with gaols that are measured over time and updated
daily. Habits such as sleep routines are tracked as averages to see the
average sleep time. Projects are completed by milestones. Thus the percentage
method works best for them.

2\. Daily Routines

We add different goals due on different days. Some goals and tasks are
recurring, thus requiring daily reminders. The daily routines feature allows
users to focus on tasks for the present day instead of worrying over all tasks
simultaneously.

Focusing on tasks due on a particular day is a great way to relieve stress and
promote the “live for today” mantra. It helps users focus on current work and
take baby steps towards completing big goals.

Also, Strides evokes a sense of achievement by awarding users the “perfect
day” badge when they complete all tasks lined up for the day and move them to
the “done” section. If users forget to mark tasks, they can always return to
previous dates and mark them as done. Thus, for Strides users, passed time is
not lost, it can always be reclaimed.

3\. Progress Reports

Another stunning feature in the Strides app is the layout of the progress
reports. One might expect the reports to follow a unified layout with the same
units representing all data. However, Strides is a pleasant surprise with its
unique progress report format, where every task or goal progress is measured
in its exclusive unit.

This means that a single progress layout displays weight goals as kilograms,
jogging as kilometers, profits as percentages, and sleep as average hours, all
in the same display. Users no longer have to swap between screens or goals to
see progress.

### Pros

  * Different tracker types
  * Updated habit trackers
  * Daily goals
  * Sync with Apple Watch

### Cons

  * Not available on desktop or android devices
  * Not suitable for teams

### Supported Platforms

  * macOS
  * iOS

### Pricing

  * Free version
  * Paid plans from $4.99 per user per month

### Customer support

  * FAQs

### Ratings

There are no ratings for this application.

### Conclusion

Strides is a focused goal and habit tracker that promises straightforward
progress and uninterrupted goal completion. It offers different ways of
measuring progress for various goals to offer a seamless experience.

However, this goal-setting app lags behind in several aspects, so it fails to
make an impression. The mobile app is unavailable for android devices and
windows operating systems, thereby badly limiting its accessibility. Strides
is also more of a personal habit tracker app than a business goal-setting
tool.

## 4\. Weekdone

Weekdone is another goal-setting app that offers an intuitive interface that
offers a feature-packed experience to teams and individuals. It promises
productivity through some benchmark frameworks such as OKRs and KPIs.

Weedone’s features focus mainly on the goal-setting needs of teams and
businesses. However, it is practical for personal use as well. Weekdone uses
the OKR framework that lets users create goals and measure them through
tangible metrics. It provides better results and enhances productivity for
businesses and people in general.

### Features

  * Goals tracking
  * OKRs
  * Weekly progress
  * KPIs
  * Color coded progress
  * Tv dashboards
  * Team connections
  * Automated reports
  * Connection with apps

### Top 3 Features

  1. Objective Key Results

Weekdone is another goal tracker app that uses the Objective Key Results
method to drive impactful actions that guarantee success. This framework is
especially useful for teams and companies where strategic planning is based on
clear objectives and is measured through key results.

With Weekdone, users can set and view set goals and determine their action
plan accordingly. The multiple view options present various methods of viewing
goals and associated tasks delegated to team members. Additionally, users can
see the total progress made.

2\. Hierarchy View and More

Weekdone allows three main view options to present a better and more detailed
view of goals and delegated tasks throughout the company’s hierarchy. Users
can see goals in the hierarchy and tree view and quickly view all progress in
the overview section.

The hierarchy view shows goals in a complete hierarchy. The top displays the
goals set for the entire company. It is followed by goals set for team members
based on their roles and position within the company. All members are well
aware of the responsibilities delegated to everyone based on their roles.

The tree view presents goals at a glance to provide a more holistic view. This
view presents more information on the tasks instead of the people they are
assigned to. However, users can see assignees with their name initials.

Finally, the overview is a precise yet comprehensive view of all goals and
progress. The interactive display in lines and numbers gives an instant
insight into the progress toward set goals.

3\. Automatic Reports

Automatic reports are an easy and quick way to analyze company progress. These
progress reports are emailed to all team members so they can stay updated with
their goals and achievements.

These reports are most helpful because they present complete information about
all goals from different views. Additionally, the Tv dashboard allows users to
see the big picture of their big picture.

### Pros

  * Different views
  * Team view
  * Notifications to alert team members
  * Feedback in progress

### Cons

  * Slow app performance
  * Poor user interface
  * Lack of swift customer support
  * Time-consuming to set OKRs
  * Finding OKRs can be tricky at times

Capterra and GetApp rate Weekdone at 4.5. GetApp gives Weekdone a rating of

goal tracker app at 4.1.

### Conclusion

Weekdone is a goal-setting and tracking application accessible to all users
across multiple devices. This application focuses on teamwork and features
relevant goal-setting and progress summaries.

Some users complain about Weekdone’s complex interface and lagging mobile app.
This is a common issue that arises with applications where developers tend to
overdo the features. Therefore, it is best to opt for apps that are simple and
straightforward to avoid lags and performance issues.

Creating multi-level goals is a great way of staying on track with set goals.

Multi-level goals measure progress by percentage or yes or no aspects. Users

Thus, every goal presents differently for maximum convenience for users.

## FAQs

### 1\. Is it worthwhile to set goals?

In our fast-paced lives, we often underestimate the importance of having
goals. Setting goals is even more important in busy routines as they help us
focus on things that have a fruitful impact on our lives. They allow us to
direct our efforts in the right direction and live healthier, prosperous
lives.

### 2\. What are the benefits of Goal-setting apps?

The key benefit of having a goal-setting app is that they maintain your focus
on your goals and prevent distraction or effort in the wrong direction. These
apps not only help in setting goals, they keep on reminding us to complete the
milestones to achieve our target.

Additionally, goal-setting apps feature journals which are an amazing way of
staying connected and updated with our aspirations and aims.

### 3\. Who should use the goal-setting apps?

Contrary to popular belief, goal-setting apps are equally important and
beneficial for everyone. These apps let users have a set sense of direction
and completing milestones brings immense relief and motivation which is a
performance catalyst for all.

### 4\. What is a prime must-have in a goal-setting app?

Although goal-setting apps should have several features such as adding SMART
goals and OKRs, the most important one is to have convenient integration with
other apps and software. Integrations allow users to connect several apps and
enable notifications instead of switching between apps and adding tasks
manually.

### 5\. How do I know if a certain goal-setting app is right for me?

Luckily, some intelligent applications allow users to download a free trial
version through which they can explore all features and determine whether it
works for them. Goal-setting apps such as Week Plan let users enjoy a free
trial that lets them experience the app before making their final purchase.

## Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

### 1\. What is a monthly goal planner?

A Monthly Goal Planner is a software or tool that assists individuals in
setting, tracking, and achieving their monthly objectives.

### 2\. Why should I use a monthly goal planner?

Using a Monthly Goal Planner can significantly improve your efficiency and
productivity. It allows you to prioritize tasks, stay organized, and focus
clearly on your monthly objectives.

### 3\. How is Week Plan different from other monthly goal planners?

Week Plan stands out due to its intuitive interface, comprehensive features
tailored for goal planning, and emphasis on aligning daily tasks with larger
objectives.

### 4\. How often should I update my monthly goal planner?

Reviewing and updating your Monthly Goal Planner at least once a week is
recommended. This regular check-in allows you to assess your progress.

### 5\. Can I use Week Plan for goals beyond just monthly planning?

Absolutely! While Week Plan excels as a Monthly Goal Planner, it’s versatile
enough to cater to daily, weekly, quarterly, and even annual planning. It
ensures that your daily tasks align with your more significant objectives, no
matter the timeframe.

### 6\. What should I consider when choosing a monthly goal planner?

When selecting a monthly goal planner, consider factors like ease of use,
feature set, platform compatibility (web, mobile, desktop), pricing, and user
reviews.

### 7\. Is digital planning better than traditional paper-based planning?

Both digital and paper-based planning have their merits. Digital planners like
Week Plan offer synchronization across devices, automatic reminders, and easy
editing. On the other hand, some people find the physical act of writing in a
paper planner to be more personal and tangible.

### 8\. How can I ensure that I stay committed to my monthly goals?

Consistency is key. Regularly reviewing and updating your goals, celebrating
small wins, and having a clear visualization of your objectives (like with
Week Plan’s interface) can significantly improve commitment levels.

### 9\. How does Week Plan support monthly goal planning?

Week Plan allows users to set long-term objectives and break them down into
monthly goals. This way, users can track their progress throughout the month
and ensure they can achieve their goals.

### 10\. Can I share my monthly goals with a team using Week Plan?

Yes, Week Plan offers collaborative features that allow you to share goals,
tasks, and progress with a team, making it suitable for individual and team
projects and objectives.
